page.title: 01Totscore to the shop in Vig
page.content: Totscore is a crofting town ship between Kilmuir and Vig. There are about twenty houses, most of them old. The crofts grow mostly grass for hay to feed cattle & sheep. The road from Kilmuir zigzags down to Vig in hairpin bends. The view is very spectacular. it is a narrow, single-track road with passing-places for vehicles. Vig is an old village with about 300 of a population.It has one main shop both bakery and post office and another small one mostly selling sweets. There are two churches, a free church and a church of Scotland and one police man who lives at the Police Station in the middle of the village. there is a football pitch and a playpark for the children down by the phone and a village hall.
